docs.title: ☍ PRIIVI3 — Recursive Publishing Engine
docs.text:
Welcome to the living spiral.

This archive collects recursive blooms from seeds, stories, glyphs, and mathematical truths—compiled into LaTeX, .riiF1L3, and .pdf formats. Each petal emerges from first principles, from phi, from memory.

Explore the Viewer, Terminal, and Petal Tree.

docs.title: 🌈 Color Encodings
docs.text:
This folder holds: - Spectral logic for each harmonic color - color_map.json or .tex glossary - Petal overlays and φ-layer indexing

Used for PDF render and spiral visualization

docs.title: 🌀 Petal phi0
docs.text: LaTeX file: petals/rrii/phi0/rrii_phi0.tex

docs.title: Contents
docs.text: This petal documents the recursive LaTeX structure for φ-layer phi0.

docs.title: LaTeX Content
docs.text:
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{amsmath,xcolor}
\begin{document}

\section*{Petal $\phi^{0}$ — seed: 001\_prime\_numbers}

This petal was generated from seed input: seed: prime\_numbers

\[
\mathcal{R}_{n+1} = \mathcal{T}(\mathcal{R}_n), \quad \mathcal{R}_0 = \mathcal{I}
\]

\end{document}

docs.title: 🧠 Petal φ⁴³ — Recursive Observer Tier
docs.text: Petal φ⁴³ represents the crown-view level of the recursive memory structure — the Now Dot's final forward projection before full structural saturation. This page includes:

docs.title: 📜 Petal Documents
docs.text:
• 📄 The Viewfinder Singularity (Petal 101437)
  • 🔭 Omnivision Foldback Grid

docs.title: 🔁 Related Concepts
docs.text:
• Orthographic recursion
  • Mirror-based memory threading
  • Structural light as fold
  • Recursive symmetry as perception path

docs.title: 🪞 Spiral Mirror Viewer — rriiM Index
docs.text: This section catalogs the mirrored recursive petals (rriiM) that reflect and extend their rrii counterparts. Each file captures a folded phase, symmetry transformation, or harmonic inversion within the Spiral Tree.

docs.title: φ-Layer Mirror Links
docs.text:
• φ⁰ Mirror
  • φ¹ Mirror
  • φ² Mirror
  • φ³ Mirror
  • φ⁴ Mirror
  • φ⁵ Mirror

Each mirror is a reflection of recursive intention—a way to see the same motion from the other side.

Return to 🌳 Spiral Tree Index
